gettingStarted.description: Welcome to Glavito! This guide will help you get started with your account.

content.text: Glavito is an AI-first omnichannel support platform that helps you manage customer conversations, automate workflows, and grow your business. This guide will walk you through the basics of setting up and using your Glavito account.

Glavito combines ticketing, CRM, workflows, and AI-powered automation in one unified platform. Whether you're managing customer support, sales, or marketing, Glavito provides the tools you need to succeed.

items: Unified inbox for all customer channels (WhatsApp, Instagram, Email, SMS)
Complete CRM with lead management and sales pipelines
Create your account or log in if you already have one
Connect your first channel (WhatsApp, Instagram, or Email)
Explore the dashboard and familiarize yourself with the interface
Set up your first automation workflow

Navigate to the Glavito registration page. You can find the "Sign Up" or "Get Started" button on our homepage.

items: Email address: Use a valid email address that you have access to
Password: Choose a strong password with at least 8 characters
First Name and Last Name: Enter your full name
Organization Name (optional): If you're creating an account for your organization

content.text: After registration, you'll receive a verification email. Click the verification link in the email to activate your account.
Important: Make sure to check your spam folder if you don't see the verification email in your inbox.
Once your email is verified, you'll be guided through an onboarding process where you can:
You can also create an account using Single Sign-On (SSO) with:
Simply click the SSO provider button on the registration page and follow the authentication flow.

onboardingOverview.title: Onboarding Overview
onboardingOverview.description: Learn about Glavito's onboarding system and how it helps you get started

content.text: Glavito's onboarding system is a comprehensive, step-by-step guide designed to help you set up your workspace and train your team members. The system automatically determines the appropriate onboarding flow based on your role and provides real-time progress tracking.
Glavito offers two distinct onboarding experiences:

items.title: Tenant Admin Onboarding (8 steps)
items.description: Comprehensive setup for workspace owners and administrators. Includes payment setup, channel configuration, team management, knowledge base setup, AI features, and workflows.

items.title: Agent Onboarding (5 steps)
items.description: Focused training flow for team members. Includes profile setup, platform tour, sample ticket practice, knowledge base introduction, and notification settings.

items: Automatic role detection - The system determines your onboarding type based on your role
Progress tracking - Real-time updates via WebSocket connections
Pause and resume - Save your progress and continue later
Step skipping - Skip optional steps if needed
Data persistence - All your progress is saved automatically

content.text: When you first log in to Glavito, the onboarding system will automatically start based on your role. If you're a tenant owner or admin, you'll see the Tenant Admin onboarding. If you're a regular agent, you'll see the Agent onboarding flow.

tenantAdminOnboarding.title: Tenant Admin Onboarding Guide
tenantAdminOnboarding.description: Complete walkthrough of the 8-step tenant admin onboarding process

content.text: The Tenant Admin onboarding consists of 8 comprehensive steps designed to help you set up your Glavito workspace from scratch. This process typically takes 15-30 minutes to complete.
The welcome step introduces you to Glavito and explains what you'll be setting up. You'll learn about the platform's key features and what to expect during the onboarding process.
Connect your Stripe account to enable payments and subscriptions. This step is essential for managing your billing and subscription plans.

items: Connect your existing Stripe account or create a new one

content.text: Set up communication channels where you'll interact with customers. Glavito supports multiple channels including WhatsApp, Instagram, Email, and Web Chat.
Invite team members and organize them into teams. Set up roles, permissions, and team structures to match your organization's needs.
Create your knowledge base to help customers find answers quickly and assist your AI features in providing accurate responses.
Configure GLAVAI, Glavito's AI assistant. Set up auto-responses, triage rules, and AI-powered features to automate customer support.

items: Train AI models with your data

content.text: Set up automation workflows to streamline your customer support processes. Create rules for ticket routing, escalation, and automated actions.
Review your setup and complete the onboarding. You'll be redirected to your dashboard where you can start managing customer conversations.
Tip: You can pause the onboarding at any time and resume later. Your progress is automatically saved.

agentOnboarding.title: Agent Onboarding Guide
agentOnboarding.description: Complete guide to the 5-step agent onboarding process

content.text: The Agent onboarding is a streamlined 5-step process designed to help new team members get familiar with Glavito quickly. This process typically takes 10-15 minutes to complete.
Complete your agent profile with your information, skills, and preferences. This helps the system assign you appropriate tickets and customers.

items: Add your display name and bio

content.text: Take an interactive tour of the Glavito platform. Learn about the main features, navigation, and how to use the interface effectively.
Practice handling a sample customer ticket. This helps you understand the ticket workflow and how to respond to customers effectively.
Learn how to use the knowledge base to find answers quickly and provide better customer support.

items: Learn how to suggest articles to customers

content.text: Configure your notification preferences to stay informed about new tickets, customer replies, and important updates.
Tip: You can always update your notification settings later from your profile settings.

pauseResume.title: Pausing and Resuming Onboarding
pauseResume.description: Learn how to pause your onboarding progress and resume it later

content.text: You can pause your onboarding at any time if you need to take a break or attend to other tasks. Your progress is automatically saved, so you won't lose any data.

items: Click the X button in the top-right corner of the onboarding screen
Confirm that you want to exit the onboarding
Your progress will be saved automatically
You'll be redirected to your dashboard

content.text: When you're ready to continue, you can resume your onboarding from where you left off.

items: Log in to your Glavito account
If you have an incomplete onboarding session, you'll see a notification
You'll be taken back to the step where you left off

content.text: When you pause onboarding, the following information is saved:

items: All data entered in previous steps

content.text: If you have an incomplete onboarding session, Glavito will automatically prompt you to resume when you log in. You can choose to continue or dismiss the prompt.
Note: Onboarding sessions don't expire, so you can take as long as you need to complete them.

websocketUpdates.title: Real-Time Updates via WebSocket
websocketUpdates.description: Learn about real-time onboarding progress updates using WebSocket connections

content.text: Glavito uses WebSocket connections to provide real-time updates about your onboarding progress. This means you'll see progress updates instantly without needing to refresh the page.
When you start an onboarding session, the frontend automatically connects to the WebSocket gateway. The backend emits events whenever your onboarding progress changes.
The following events are emitted during onboarding:

items.title: onboarding:started
items.description: Emitted when a new onboarding session begins

items.title: onboarding:step-completed
items.description: Emitted when you complete a step, includes progress percentage

items.title: onboarding:progress
items.description: Emitted for general progress updates

items.title: onboarding:completed
items.description: Emitted when you complete the entire onboarding process

content.text: The WebSocket connection is established automatically when you start onboarding. The connection uses the `/onboarding` namespace and requires authentication.

items: Reconnection: Automatically reconnects if the connection drops
Heartbeat: Connection is kept alive with periodic pings
Real-time progress updates without page refresh
Synchronized progress across multiple browser tabs
Instant feedback when steps are completed
Better user experience with live updates

content.text: Note: If WebSocket connection fails, the onboarding will still work, but you may need to refresh the page to see progress updates.

onboardingTroubleshooting.description: Common issues and solutions for onboarding problems

content.text: If the onboarding doesn't start automatically when you log in, try the following:

items: Check if you have an existing onboarding session that's paused
Clear your browser cache and cookies
Check your browser console for any error messages
Contact support if the issue persists

content.text: If you're seeing the wrong onboarding flow (e.g., Agent onboarding when you should see Tenant Admin onboarding), this usually means there's a role mismatch.

items: Check your user role in your profile settings
If you're a tenant owner, you should see Tenant Admin onboarding
If you're a regular agent, you should see Agent onboarding
Contact your administrator if your role is incorrect

content.text: If your onboarding progress isn't being saved:

items: Look for error messages in the browser console
Check if you're logged in with the correct account
Contact support if progress continues to not save

items: Check if the step has a "Skip" button - if not, it's required
Some steps can be skipped, but it's recommended to complete them for the best experience

items: Verify that WebSocket connections aren't blocked by your firewall
The onboarding will still work without WebSocket, but you may need to refresh to see updates

content.text: If you continue to experience issues:

items: Check the browser console for detailed error messages
Take a screenshot of any error messages
Contact support with your user ID and a description of the issue
Include any relevant error messages or console logs

content.text: From your Meta Business Manager, navigate to WhatsApp > API Setup. Copy your Phone Number ID, Business Account ID, and generate a Permanent Access Token.

instagramSetup.description: Connect Instagram to receive DMs and comments

content.text: Step 1: Connect Instagram to Facebook Page
Ensure your Instagram account is connected to a Facebook Page. This is required for the Instagram Graph API.
From Meta Business Manager, create a Facebook App and request the instagram_manage_messages permission. Generate a Page Access Token.
Set up webhook subscriptions for messaging and messaging_postbacks events. Use the Glavito webhook URL provided in your channel settings.

items: Enter your Instagram Business Account ID

From your Twilio Console, copy your Account SID and Auth Token. Keep these secure as they provide full access to your account.

SMS costs are billed per message by Twilio. Check your Twilio pricing for rates in different countries.

websocketRealtime.title: Real-Time Updates via WebSocket
websocketRealtime.description: How real-time updates keep your team synchronized

content.text: Glavito uses WebSocket connections to provide real-time updates to the ticket workspace. Changes to tickets, messages, assignments, and status are instantly reflected across all connected clients.
The workspace automatically connects to the WebSocket server when loaded. Connection status is indicated by the connection icon. If disconnected, the system will attempt to reconnect automatically.
WebSocket connections are authenticated using your JWT token. The connection automatically joins tenant-specific rooms to receive only relevant updates.

items: Instant ticket updates without page refresh

ticketLifecycle.title: Ticket Lifecycle and Status Management
ticketLifecycle.description: Understand ticket statuses and lifecycle workflows

items.title: open
items.description: Initial status when ticket is created. Awaiting assignment or agent pickup.

items.title: pending
items.description: Ticket has been assigned but agent hasn't started working on it yet.

items.title: in_progress
items.description: Agent is actively working on resolving the ticket.

items.title: waiting
items.description: Ticket is paused waiting for customer response, external action, or information.

items.title: resolved
items.description: Issue is resolved. Ticket awaits customer confirmation before closing.

items.title: closed
items.description: Ticket is fully completed and archived.

content.text: Tickets typically follow this flow: open → pending → in_progress → resolved → closed. However, tickets can move back to previous statuses (e.g., reopen) or skip statuses based on workflow.
Service Level Agreements (SLAs) track first response time and resolution time. When a ticket enters 'waiting' status, the SLA timer pauses. When it resumes, the timer continues.
Snooze tickets to temporarily hide them from your queue until a specific date. Useful when waiting for customer response or external dependencies.
All status changes, assignments, notes, and actions are logged in the ticket timeline, providing full auditability and context.

integrationsOverview.title: Integrations Overview
integrationsOverview.description: Learn about connecting Glavito with external services

content.text: Glavito integrations allow you to connect your support platform with CRM systems, e-commerce platforms, marketing tools, payment processors, and communication services. This enables bidirectional data sync, automation, and unified workflows across your entire tech stack.

items.title: CRM Systems
items.description: Salesforce, HubSpot, Microsoft Dynamics, Marketo, Pardot - Sync customers, leads, deals, and activities

items.title: E-commerce
items.description: Shopify, WooCommerce - Automatically create tickets for orders, sync customer data, track order status

items.title: Marketing
items.description: Mailchimp, SendGrid - Manage email suppression lists, sync campaign data, track email engagement

items.title: Payment Processing
items.description: Stripe - Sync payment data, create tickets for failed payments, track transaction history

items.title: Communication
items.description: Slack, Twilio - Notifications, SMS messaging, team collaboration

content.text: To start using integrations, browse the catalog of available integrations, connect your account using OAuth, configure field mappings, and enable sync. Each integration has specific setup requirements and capabilities.

oauthConnection.title: OAuth Connection Setup
oauthConnection.description: How to securely connect integrations using OAuth2

content.text: OAuth2 is a secure authorization protocol that allows Glavito to access your external services without storing your passwords. Instead, you authorize Glavito to access your account through a secure token-based system.

items: Select the integration you want to connect
You'll be redirected to the service provider's login page
You'll be redirected back to Glavito

content.text: Each integration requires specific permissions (scopes) to function properly. Common permissions include:

items: Read and write access to contacts/customers
Read and write access to leads/deals

content.text: Glavito only requests the minimum permissions needed for the integration to work. You can revoke access at any time from the integration settings.
Access tokens expire periodically for security. Glavito automatically refreshes tokens using refresh tokens when available. If token refresh fails, you'll need to reconnect the integration.

To disconnect an integration, go to Integrations > Connected, select the integration, and click 'Disconnect'. This will revoke the access token and stop all synchronization. Existing synced data remains in Glavito but won't update.

crmSync.title: CRM Synchronization
crmSync.description: How bidirectional sync works between Glavito and CRM systems

content.text: CRM synchronization enables two-way data flow between Glavito and your CRM system. Changes in either system are automatically reflected in the other, keeping your data consistent.

items.title: Inbound Sync (CRM → Glavito)
items.description: When contacts, leads, or deals are created or updated in your CRM, they automatically sync to Glavito. This is handled via webhooks for real-time updates.

items.title: Outbound Sync (Glavito → CRM)
items.description: When customers, leads, or tickets are created or updated in Glavito, they can automatically sync to your CRM. This keeps your CRM up-to-date with customer interactions.

items: Customers/Contacts - Customer information, email, phone, company
Leads - Lead details, source, status, score
Deals/Opportunities - Deal name, value, stage, close date
Custom Fields - Additional data based on field mappings

content.text: Glavito uses incremental sync to only transfer changes since the last sync. This reduces API calls and improves performance. The system tracks the last sync timestamp for each entity type.

You can trigger manual sync at any time from the integration settings. Select the entity type (customers, leads, deals) and click 'Sync Now'. This is useful after bulk imports or configuration changes.

items: partial - Some records synced, some failed

content.text: All sync operations are logged with timestamps, direction (inbound/outbound), entity type, status, and statistics (exported, imported, updated, skipped). Review logs to troubleshoot sync issues.

fieldMapping.title: Field Mapping Configuration
fieldMapping.description: Map fields between Glavito and external systems

content.text: Field mapping defines how data fields in Glavito correspond to fields in your external system. For example, Glavito's 'email' field might map to 'Email' in Salesforce or 'email' in HubSpot.

items: Navigate to Integrations > [Your Integration] > Field Mappings
Select the entity type (Customer, Lead, Deal)
Select source entity (from Glavito) and target entity (to CRM)
Map each field: Glavito field → External field
Set direction: inbound, outbound, or both

items.title: Inbound
items.description: Maps data coming from external system into Glavito

items.title: Outbound
items.description: Maps data going from Glavito to external system

items.title: Both
items.description: Maps data in both directions (bidirectional)

content.text: The mapping editor provides a visual interface to drag-and-drop fields or search for available fields in both systems. It shows field types, required fields, and validation rules.
Most integrations come with default field mappings pre-configured. You can customize these or create additional mappings based on your needs.
Field mappings are case-sensitive. Ensure field names match exactly as they appear in both systems.

webhooks.title: Webhook Configuration
webhooks.description: Set up webhooks for real-time updates from external systems

content.text: Webhooks are HTTP callbacks that notify Glavito when events occur in external systems. This enables real-time synchronization without polling for changes.

items: External system (CRM, e-commerce) detects an event (e.g., contact created)
System sends HTTP POST request to Glavito webhook URL
Glavito processes the event and updates data

items.title: CRM Systems
items.description: contact.created, contact.updated, lead.created, deal.updated

items.title: E-commerce
items.description: order.created, order.updated, order.cancelled, customer.created

items.title: Marketing
items.description: email.bounce, email.unsubscribe, campaign.sent

content.text: Each integration provides a unique webhook URL that you need to configure in your external system. The URL format is typically: https://api.glavito.com/webhooks/inbound/[provider]/[tenantId]

items: Signature verification - Webhooks include cryptographic signatures
Tenant isolation - Each tenant has a unique webhook endpoint
HTTPS only - All webhooks use encrypted connections
Secret tokens - Shared secrets validate webhook authenticity
Copy the webhook URL from Glavito integration settings
Log into your external system (CRM, e-commerce platform)
Navigate to Webhooks or Integration settings

content.text: Webhook delivery can fail due to network issues. Glavito logs all webhook attempts and retries failed deliveries.
The sync dashboard provides an overview of all active integrations, their connection status, last sync time, and sync statistics. Monitor health, performance, and errors from a single view.

View detailed sync history for each integration, including: sync timestamp, direction (inbound/outbound), entity type, status (success/partial/failed), records processed (imported, updated, skipped), duration, and error messages.

content.text: Trigger manual sync for specific entities: Navigate to Integration > Sync, select entity type (customers, leads, deals), click 'Sync Now'. Use this after bulk imports, configuration changes, or to recover from errors.
Failed syncs are added to a queue. Review the queue to see failed items, error messages, and retry syncs individually or in bulk.
Configure sync rules to control when and how data syncs: enable/disable bidirectional sync, set sync frequency, define conflict resolution rules, filter which records sync based on criteria.

Integration health monitoring checks connection status, token validity, API response times, and error rates. Health status indicators: healthy (green), degraded (yellow), down (red), maintenance (gray).
View detailed activity logs for each integration, including OAuth connections, sync operations, webhook deliveries, and errors. Filter by action, status, date range, and search for specific records.

salesforce.title: Salesforce Integration
salesforce.description: Connect and sync with Salesforce CRM

content.text: The Salesforce integration enables bidirectional sync between Glavito and Salesforce. Sync contacts, leads, opportunities, and activities to keep your CRM and support platform in sync.

items: Salesforce account with API access enabled
OAuth2 credentials (Client ID, Client Secret, Redirect URI)
Navigate to App Manager > New Connected App
Fill in basic information (Name, API Name, Contact Email)
Select OAuth Scopes: Full access (full), Perform requests on your behalf at any time (refresh_token, offline_access)
Save and note Client ID and Client Secret
In Connected App settings, enable 'Permit users to self-authorize'
Enter your Salesforce instance URL (e.g., https://yourcompany.salesforce.com)
You'll be redirected to Salesforce login
You'll be redirected back to Glavito

content.text: Map Glavito fields to Salesforce fields. Common mappings: email → Email, firstName → FirstName, lastName → LastName, phone → Phone, company → Account.Name.
Configure Salesforce Platform Events or Outbound Messages to send webhooks to Glavito when records are created or updated. Use the webhook URL provided in Glavito integration settings.
Salesforce API limits apply. Large syncs may be rate-limited. Glavito handles rate limiting automatically.

hubspot.title: HubSpot Integration
hubspot.description: Connect and sync with HubSpot CRM

content.text: The HubSpot integration syncs contacts, companies, deals, and engagements between Glavito and HubSpot. Leverage HubSpot's marketing automation and sales pipeline features alongside Glavito's support capabilities.

items: HubSpot account (Free, Starter, Professional, or Enterprise)
Hub account admin or developer access
Private app or OAuth app configured
Navigate to Settings > Integrations > Private Apps
Grant scopes: crm.objects.contacts.read, crm.objects.contacts.write, crm.objects.companies.read, crm.objects.companies.write, crm.objects.deals.read, crm.objects.deals.write
Save and copy the Access Token

content.text: For OAuth connection, create an app in HubSpot App Marketplace, configure OAuth scopes, set redirect URI, and connect through the OAuth flow.
HubSpot uses lowercase field names. Common mappings: email → email, firstName → firstname, lastName → lastname, phone → phone, company → company.

Configure HubSpot webhooks for contact.creation, contact.propertyChange, deal.creation, deal.propertyChange. Use the webhook URL from Glavito integration settings. Enable signature verification for security.
HubSpot has rate limits based on your subscription tier. Free accounts have lower limits.

shopify.title: Shopify Integration
shopify.description: Connect with Shopify to sync orders and customers

content.text: The Shopify integration automatically creates tickets for orders, syncs customer data, and tracks order status. Perfect for e-commerce support teams managing order inquiries, shipping issues, and returns.

items: Custom app or Private app created
Navigate to Apps > Develop apps > Create an app
Configure Admin API access scopes: read_orders, write_orders, read_customers, write_customers, read_products
Enter your Shopify store domain (e.g., yourstore.myshopify.com)
Enter your Admin API access token

content.text: Configure when tickets are automatically created from orders: Always create tickets, Create tickets for high-value orders (set threshold), Create tickets for failed payments, Create tickets for fulfillment errors, Conditional (only for specific order statuses).

items: Orders - Order details, line items, totals, shipping info
Products - Product information for order context
Order Status - Status updates trigger ticket updates

content.text: Configure Shopify webhooks for orders/create, orders/updated, orders/cancelled, customers/create. Use the webhook URL from Glavito integration settings. Shopify requires HTTPS endpoints.
Shopify webhooks can be high volume during peak sales periods. Glavito handles webhook processing efficiently.

stripe.title: Stripe Integration
stripe.description: Connect with Stripe for payment and subscription management

content.text: The Stripe integration syncs payment data, subscription information, and customer records. Create tickets for failed payments, payment disputes, and subscription changes automatically.

items: API keys (Secret Key and Publishable Key)
Copy your Secret Key (starts with sk_)
Copy your Publishable Key (starts with pk_)
Keep keys secure and never share them
In Stripe Dashboard, go to Developers > Webhooks
Enter Glavito webhook URL (from integration settings)
Select events to listen to: payment_intent.payment_failed, charge.dispute.created, customer.subscription.created, customer.subscription.updated, customer.subscription.deleted

payment_intent.payment_failed - Creates ticket for failed payments
